text: Activated <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediates apoptosis , cell cycle arrest , senescence , DNA repair , or metabolism ( Lane and Levine , 2010 ) .
The primary structures of <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and its isoforms are depicted ( Figure 2 ) .

<extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces cell cycle arrest by transactivating genes such as cyclin - dependent kinase inhibitor <extra_id_0> p21 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , or microRNA <extra_id_0> miR34 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces apoptosis by transactivating proapoptotic genes such as <extra_id_0> BAX <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> PUMA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> SCOTIN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> FAS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and inhibiting the antiapoptotic gene <extra_id_0> BCL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Lane and Levine , 2010 ) .

<extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> triggers pro-survival or cell death response , depending upon cell types , the intensity of the stress signal , and the extent of cellular damage ( Menendez et al . , 2009 ) .

Also , <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a role in controlling cell motility via regulating the expression of <extra_id_0> smooth muscle alpha-actin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Comer et al . , 1998 ) , <extra_id_0> collagens IIalpha1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> VIalpha1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( Sun et al . , 1999 ) , and many others .
